    Webstorm

    Concepts

    Using AFS how to do what from the following?

    Setting up & connecting through a terminal to AFS

      In Webstorm, to connect through a terminal go to the top bar and select 'Tools' and then at the bottom of the menu click on 'start SSH session'. After that, click 'Edit credentials to input the host's and your user's information. In the 'Host' bar type 'afs1.njit.edu' (You could enter any number after afs between 1 and 22 because of 22 ports), then input your UCID Username and Password. After pressing ok your terminal will be connected to AFS.

    Using Linux commands

      You can use Linux commands to communicate with AFS. Some basic linux commands are:

        1. cd - With this command you can change the directory.

        2. mkdir - With this command you can create a new directory.

        3. ls - With this command you can see the list of files and directories inside a directory.

        4. pwd - With this command you can know current directory you are in.

        5. rm -r (directory name) - With this command you can remove a directory and all of its content.

        6. touch (file name) - With this command you can create a file.

    How to create files and folders on WebStorm?

    Folders

      To make a folder, Right click your main directory and go to New menu, inside new click on 'Directory'. With that created you will be prompted to name your directory. That is how to create a folder.

    Files

      To create a file follow the same process as when creating a folder, for files instead of clicking on 'Directory' click on any kind of File in the menu selection and then name your file. To create a file under a certain directory, just Right click that directory and follow the same process.

    How to setup WebStorm to Deploy and automatic upload files to AFS?

    Deploying files to AFS

      To Deploy your directory and files to your AFS account, First go to 'Tools' menu and then 'Deployment'. After that go to 'Configuration'. After opening, select '+' and then 'SFTP'. Doing so will open a form which you will fill with your UCID username and password. As for Root path, Click 'AutoDetect' and add '/public_html' because that's where your files are all stored.

    WebStorm Automatic Upload

      To AutoSave your files and upload it to AFS go to the top menu and inside 'Tools' click on 'Deployment' and then click 'Automatic Upload' to automatically save your file and upload it to AFS.

    Finding Website on AFS

      To find your website on AFS, go to a search engine and type "web.njit.edu/~(your ucid)/your project's name/filename".

    How to setup HTML5 Boilerplate template?

    Setting HTML5 Boilerplate

      HTML5 Boilerplate is a template with which you can create a static website or a simple application. To setup a HTML5 Boilerplate template, Go to 'File' then click 'New' then 'Project'. Inside Project a pop-up window will open which will let you to create a new project. On the left side, Click 'HTML5 Boilerplate'. In the 'Location' field, specify the path to your project. In 'Version', select the latest version.

      After that type a title & description for your pull request. Then at last click the 'Create Pull Request' button. Then after creating a pull request you have to choose the 'Merge Pull Request' button to merge it to your own repository.
